ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: 1- I think there could be a bit more readings. Those that were provided were helpful.3- The personal reflection journals did not always help me grasp the concept presented that day.9- The field trip planning and execution was a great exercise in leadership.

The field trip to Washington, DC allowed the students to learn about the work conducted by different organizations and institutions and to engage in really interesting conversations with leaders from different environmental projects and organizations. Being able to have these conversations and to learn from others' experiences help me to reflect about the importance of being a leader and/or member of a team and how these roles can really influence the outcome of a project or program.
Insightful anecdotes and examples from instructorHands on learning through class organizational project plus field trip
The trip, of course!
The class trip, because we each got to participate in its realization and we made professional contacts.

Being able to understand how an organization works and different leading roles by working as an organization inside the class to organize the field trip. The experience of organizing the field trip, having regular meetings and following up the tasks was helpful to learn more about each person's working style and leadership roles. The field trip was a very valuable experience.
Great teaching, great content, excellent opportunity to practice teamwork skills and meet brilliant and nice people
The professor! He has been one of the most delightful professors to study under for his gifted characteristics of pleasantness, kindness, approachability, insightfulness, and care.

The concepts of systems thinking is an interdisciplinary tool, and Prof. Oliver does a fantastic job on teaching how to understand and use this tool. The student is then left to apply the framework to its analysis and even in other classes. My understanding and enjoyment of my agriculture and economics class was enhanced by the use of systems thinking.Secondly, the experience of making an organization to travel to Washington DC and meet with great leaders from the environmental sphere in the NGO, private and governmental areas was a memorable experience filled with life lessons.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: n/a
Structure in weekly assignments from Professor Oliver; that, or they should be dropped completely.
Perhaps less print outs, so as to use less paper?

Structure the readings and commentaries for the class in such a way that we can have forums about them, at least once every two weeks. This will encourage the class to be on the same page and do the readings.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: No TA. Instructor always extremely helpful and insightful.
Excellent.
The professor was available and always cheerful. This is much appreciated.
This course does not have a TA.
Prof. Chad Oliver is very accessible and a great help

The quality of help was great. As said, Professor Oliver is gifted with a great sense of kindness and approachability. I even once asked him to write a letter of recommendation for me with very short notice and he did so without any trouble. He is very laid back, and that creates a great atmosphere in the classroom that is very conducive to learning. For these reasons and more, i think Professor Oliver is one of F&ES's greatest assets.
Prof. Oliver was always willing to talk with you.I strongly encourage any student taking his class to go and talk with him.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Expect that I may be in leadership positions someday and the course really helped me understand how to manage various aspects of leadership.

Very well; honestly it is a hard class to prioritize into a 2 year program with everything else going on, but its a really valuable LIFE and ACADEMIC skill-building, awareness-building, and of course, leadership-building course that would help everyone.
I hope to become a leader in natural resources. This class helped me develop leadership skills and cultivate leadership knowledge.

We rarely have courses in the field of organization and leadership skills, which is a shame. This course provide this opportunity to practice and meet the people in practice, which is very helpful and valuable to understand the real world and make connections.

This course probably fits into every F&ES student's program, since it provides important insight to how things get done in politics and how we, environmental advocates, should act in our potential roles of leadership.
My answer is in Question 16.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Interest
To learn what leadership was all about.
The subject is interesting to me

First of all, I took this class as I think that understanding leadership as a tool in the NGO world is key to develop a good group work and be able to work with other institutions and leaders from across the board.Secondly I had hear very good things about Prof. Oliver´s topics and the way he develops the conversation in class.These two expectations were thoroughly fulfilled in the semester.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes and even more!
Definitely.
The course exceeded my expectations.
Yes. I love this class
It certainly surpassed my expectations. This course, along with the one taught by both Professors Tucker and Grim, was the best course i had this year.
Yes it did.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
Definitely.
Yes, I learned about leadership, different types of organizations, helpful aspects and tips about running meetings.
Yes.
Thankfully, i got even more than what i expected.
Yes I did.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Hands-on learning experience
It made the course worthwhile; it brought our pre-trip discussions into action and practical application.
Working in a group was the best way to practice some of the concepts learned in class about types of organizations and leadership.
We worked as a group to arrange a trip to DC. It is a good way to know my fellow classmates and we are best friends now.
It helped to build up or practice certain group-work-related skills that might be needed in a profession.
The class aims to teach you how to work within an organization, with its hierarchies and responsibilities. The group work is key to this goal.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it if you can. You won't regret it.
Take advantage of every minute in the class, appreciate Chad and all valuable chances he provides in class.
Bring business cards with you to the DC trip :)

Do the readings handed out by Prof. Oliver during class. These not only add to the understanding of his talks and class discussion; they are very interesting and a great source of insight for understanding systems and how to develop better leadership skills and day to day work ethics.Go to his office hours: Prof. Oliver is extremely knowledgeable and a great person to talk with.
